intro: Wahlenbergia masafuerae, commonly known as the Masafuera lily, is a flowering plant native to Chile. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its bell-shaped, blue or violet flowers. The plant typically grows in coastal areas and is adapted to sandy soils. It has narrow, grass-like leaves and produces its flowers in late summer. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and endemic species.
